Module reference

The following modules expose the public API used by the CLI, GUI and web frontends. Each module’s members are documented from the in-source docstrings using Sphinx autodoc.

ecg_analyzer.extractor.save_adaptive_params(path)[source]
Parameters:

path (str)

ecg_analyzer.extractor.load_adaptive_params(path)[source]
Parameters:

path (str)

ecg_analyzer.extractor.load_image(path)[source]

Load an image from path and return an OpenCV BGR ndarray.

Supports common image formats and single-page PDFs (requires pdf2image). The output is BGR to be consistent with OpenCV operations used elsewhere.

Parameters:

path (str)

Return type:

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.validate_image_quality(img)[source]

Quick checks to ensure the image is processable.

Returns (ok, message). Uses basic heuristics: minimum pixel count and fraction of non-white pixels to detect blank/overexposed scans.

Parameters:

img (ndarray)

Return type:

Tuple[bool, str]

ecg_analyzer.extractor.deskew_image(img)[source]

Detect dominant line angles and rotate the image to correct skew.

Uses probabilistic Hough lines on Canny edges to estimate a median angle; small angles (<0.1 deg) are ignored to avoid unnecessary resampling.

Parameters:

img (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.enhance_image(img)[source]

Apply contrast-limited adaptive histogram equalization to the L channel.

Improves local contrast for scanned ECGs that may be unevenly illuminated.

Parameters:

img (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.bandpass(signal, fs, low=0.5, high=40.0)[source]

Apply a 2nd-order Butterworth bandpass filter and zero-phase filter the signal.

This helps isolate QRS energy while preserving waveform morphology.

Parameters:

  • signal (ndarray)

  • fs (float)

  • low (float)

  • high (float)

Return type:

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.detect_r_peaks_pan_tompkin(signal, fs)[source]

Simplified Pan–Tompkins detector.

Steps: 1) Bandpass to emphasize QRS (default 5-15 Hz) 2) Differentiate to highlight slope information 3) Square to make all values positive and emphasize large slopes 4) Moving-window integrate to collect energy over a short window 5) Peak-pick on integrated signal using an adaptive threshold

Returns integer sample indices of detected R-peaks (unrefined).

Parameters:

  • signal (ndarray)

  • fs (float)

Return type:

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.refine_peaks_with_template(signal, r_peaks, fs, half_window_ms=60)[source]

Refine R-peak indices using cross-correlation with an averaged template.

For each detected beat, take a window around the R index, align multiple beats by their local maxima to form a template, then cross-correlate the template with each beat to refine the peak location. This helps correct small timing jitter and produces more consistent fiducials for downstream P/Q/S/T searches.

Parameters:

  • signal (ndarray)

  • r_peaks (ndarray)

  • fs (float)

  • half_window_ms (int)

Return type:

ndarray

ndarray

ecg_analyzer.extractor.detect_pqrst(signal, r_peaks, fs)[source]

Detect P, Q, R, S, T sample indices around each R-peak. Returns dict with lists of indices (or None when not found).

Parameters:

  • signal (ndarray)

  • r_peaks (ndarray)

  • fs (float)

Return type:

Dict[str, List[int | None]]

ecg_analyzer.extractor.process_file(path, output=None, out_format='csv', show_plot=False)[source]
Parameters:

  • path (str)

  • output (str | None)

  • out_format (str)

  • show_plot (bool)

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Command-line interface for processing ECG images.

This module exposes a simple CLI entrypoint used by python -m ecg_analyzer.cli. It supports single-file and batch processing and mirrors the options described in the SRS: –input, –output, –format, and a –show-plot flag.

ecg_analyzer.cli.main()[source]

Parse arguments and run processing on one or more input files.

  • If multiple inputs are provided and –output is a folder, each file is written to <out_folder>/<basename>_results.<format>.

  • For a single input, –output may be a file path or omitted to print results to stdout as JSON.

Simple Tkinter-based GUI for interactive ECG image processing.

The GUI lets the user choose an ECG image, runs the processing pipeline and displays the original image plus a waveform plot. The plot supports zoom/pan via the Matplotlib navigation toolbar and toggles to show/hide gridlines and feature markers.
